name: eXceed - Gun Bullet Children
description: Humanity is at war against vampires and deviants. Mankind's last line of defense is a group of children trained to wield powerful magic that can rival the demonic hordes, but at the cost of most of their lifespan. Likened to bullets of a gun, they are known as the ‘Gun Bullet Children’.The time is NOW!
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows Vista®, XP, Windows 7 Processor:Pentium 1.0GHz or better Memory:128 MB RAM Graphics:Intel 915(900) or better DirectX®:8.0 Hard Drive:172 MB HD space

reviews.review_text: Lower production values than 2nd or 3rd. The music is good if you're a trance fan and the gameplay is good if you're a big fan of grazers, otherwise there are cool patterns that drag on too long if you don't graze to charge your meter. All the bullets are red and kinda ugly and there's little offered visually as a whole. A worthwhile purchase if you're bored or want the complete set, but completely bypassable if you're on a budget or just want to get to the meat of the series--2nd and 3rd are exponentially better in every way.

Touhou > This. ANYDAY OF THE ♥♥♥♥ING WEEK.  Music 8/10. It has a bumpin track (Similar to Xtreme G for nintendo 64). The music is probly the best, and only good aspect of this game. Colours 3/10. My eyes got cancer. Red for every bullet. EVERY BULLET. Hitboxes 2/10 I've encounted some pretty ♥♥♥♥♥♥ hitboxes in my time, but this...this is something special. Waifu's ???/10. Game is in moonspeak. Cant understand any character development, assume there is some.  My biggest problem is when using the slow function, you cant see your defined hitbox. All I see is a blinding, rotating star that looks like it could have lead the 3 wise men to baby Jesus.  Overall, I give this game a steamingturd / 10.

idk why there's a lot of hate in the reviews but i really liked the game, it's not the greatest danmaku game but i don't see it bad.  A lot of friends of mine don't want this game because it's in japanese, if you don't want to buy this game because of that don't worry, because there's a patch to change the languaje to english, you just have to google it.  The controls are the only thing i see bad about eXceed 1.  7/10

I wish I could get this game to run so I could make fun of it, but I can't. It doesn't work on my system. If you're a fan of bullet-hell's, stay away from this one.  Not Ikaruga/10 Can't think of a joke that doesn't involve child porn.    OH WAIT THAT WORKS
I dont like writing short reviews, but there's nothing to say here. LADIES AND GENTLEMAN, IT'S COUNTERFEIT TOUHOU, AND IT'S GOOD, AND IT'S CHEAP, SO GET IT WHILE YOU CAN

eXceed is a series of 'bullet hell' shmup games. This first game is similar in concept to the Touhou Project. You play one of three girls specially trained by the Catholic Church in the ways of magic, each with different attack paterns to hunt down vampires. Bullet hell games often require a lot of patience to graciously dodge the enemy projectiles and like the Touhou series has a focus on story driven character boss battles. It's a game that requires a lot of patience but is a lot of fun.  Only downside about this particular game is that the controll is not optimized for analog sticks nor is it translated from Japanese. You'll need to download at patch to get it in English.

A decent danmaku with pretty damn good soundtrack. It comes with Japanese language by default but with a quick Google search you'll be able to find the translation patch for this game and get English text.

THIS...this would be absolutely effing epic if they could fix the fps, put in the steam overlay, and fix some of the controls, plus do a translation.  EDIT: go through forums. there's a fix for language and a fix for fps. although.... the company themselves should be fixing this, not the customers.  Even as is, totally worth the $1 i paid for it.  Extremely underrated compared to the rest of the series. the extremely long boss battles actually somewhat add to the gameplay, I think... kind of a mental endurance game. Soundtrack is great. Shibuyan's also done a ton of Touhou Project arranges as well. ;)   The game developers should push for steam acheivements, leaderboards, and some soundtrack dlc, etc. There's a lot of potential here that's being missed out on.
this scrolling shooter game will bring you back to the golden age of some old consoles like NES-SNES or FAMICOM my childhood 9/10
I love a good bullet hell! Go for the complete pack.
This is a pretty simple bullet hell. It's not too hard, but challenging enough to make it worth a play through or two.
Lots of bullets, don't get hit, hard game. 420/69 'Ok' - IGN  2nd and 3rd one make my eyes hurt less
Played the entire story mode. Good game to play in free time.  7/10

eXceed isn't a terrible game, but it is an entirely inessential one. It gets the fundamentals of a bullet hell game right but does nothing unique to distinguish itself, and with so many other similar, better games to choose from (including two superior sequels) I'm at a loss to come up with any reason to spend time with it. The overly compressed graphics and audio, and the inability to save or continue a previous game also cause it to feel particularly dated and archaic, presuming you actually manage to make it work.  I can't exactly call it broken, but eXceed has major problems running on modern computers. For reasons I'm still unclear about it's virtually impossible to get the originally intended 60fps on anything but ancient hardware, and with the speed of the game directly tied to the frame rate less than that is functionally like playing in slow motion. With enemies and bullets moving at a snails pace the action changes from fun and challenging to downright boring. I'm not joking when I say I had more trouble keeping myself awake than completing the first three levels, at which point I just couldn't take it anymore.  Outside of for free I wouldn't recommend eXceed, and even then only to those with an old computer lying around to play it on. Everyone else can skip straight to the sequels and not miss anything, as the original is now little more than a placeholder.

If you're a hardcore bullet hell fan, you likely already know everything there is to know about this game.  If you're a casual or average gamer who occasionally enjoys a trip through bullet hell, skip this title as there are much better shooters out there.  PROS - Controls are tight. Catch it on the right sale and you can get it for free once you sell the trading cards.  CONS - Low resolution (640x480 which can't be changed). No English.  MEH - Nearly everything else about this game.

There is so much wrong with this game, I would be here all day if I talked about it all. So, I will mentioned the only thing good about this game. The soundtrack. Yup, that is it. Granted this game is a port of a older game but the developers could have, atleast modified the controls and add english subtitles. Unless this game is free, don't even bother. Just garbage.
the most weak part of the eXceed series. The soundtrack sounds like crap and my xbox360 pad did not work very well. I cant recommend this part.
It's like Touhou. eXcept it's slow, unresponsive, and overall terrible. Don't waste your time with this, go play Touhou if you want to play a danmaku shooter.
completly ♥♥♥♥in unplayable slow as ♥♥♥♥ dont buy this ♥♥♥♥ shit
This game isn't terrible, but it has a depressingly low resolution and has inferior gameplay to the latter two entries into the series. Skip this one and play those.

If you are looking for a basic bullet hell shooter then this game would do.  If you are looking for a bullet hell shooter with localized text and better options (Windowed, 2x, 3x) then steer away from this game. The music is the only thing that can't be adjusted on this thing and the key presses in the game are global. If you downsize your window and decide chat with someone and press those keys then you may end up screwing yourself over in the game.
Unplayable. Resolution is locked to 800x600 and windowed mode isn't available. The screen flashes annoyingly to white and controller doesn't fully work.

The game is barely playable.   It's worse than those horrible flash games you can find on the internet. The Art and the music are below average, there are bugs and spelling errors everywhere, the coding is horrible and almost every bullet pattern is rehashed from other eXceed games. Some of those bullet patterns are okay, though.  Don't buy this. If you really want a danmaku game, there are better options here on Steam to choose from, or even on the internet for free.
Has Frame Rate Problems

Exceed: Gun Bullet Children is a game in which Japanese animé schoolgirls in skirts are trying to kill each other. Since this is a 'bullet hell' game, your goal is to shoot a lot and try to avoid/deflect bullets from your enemies. The game is very hard and the graphics are extremely outdated. To be honest, this just isn't a game for me.
It's not what you'd expect from a payed game. Jigoku Kisetsukan is a free danmaku on Steam and it's hundreds of times better than this one.
Can't play ;-; Buy the sequels ignore this one...      ;_;

The resolution of the game is terrible, it does not adjust my screen and I can not change it. There are no options for changing or enhancing the graph of the game. When I was in game, I saw black squares around every single bullet and also characters, which could not be tolerated. By the way, casts of the game are really nice, I love that.  Overall, it's gonna be a fairly nice game if the developer can fix these problems.
